content:
It's difficult to say what Pyrrhos would do if he were to survive until the Armageddon in his world, as the events and circumstances leading up to that battle would depend on the specific beliefs and mythology of his world. In general, the concept of Armageddon in the Bible refers to a final, cataclysmic battle between the forces of good and evil, and many believers see it as a time of judgment and the ultimate triumph of God's will.

If Pyrrhos were to survive until this final battle, he might see it as a test of his faith and a chance to fight for what he believes in. Alternatively, he might take a more passive or pragmatic approach, focusing on protecting himself and his loved ones in the face of the apocalypse. Ultimately, the actions Pyrrhos would take in such a scenario would depend on his individual character, as well as the beliefs and values of his culture and society.
